meanings.definition: The quality or state of being light in weight
meanings.sent1: The lightness of the feather made it easy to carry.
meanings.sent2: The box's lightness surprised everyone who lifted it.
meanings.sent3: The lightness of the cloud made it float effortlessly in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a lightness that lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The lightness of the balloon allowed it to soar high above the trees.

meanings.definition: The quality of being agile and nimble
meanings.sent1: The cheetah's lightness enabled it to swiftly catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: The dancer moved with such lightness and grace on the stage.
meanings.sent3: His lightness on his feet made him the star of the basketball team.
meanings.sent4: The lightness of the gymnast's movements amazed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The lightness of the ninja's steps made him almost invisible in the dark.

meanings.definition: The quality of being cheerful and carefree
meanings.sent1: Her lightness of spirit brightened up the room.
meanings.sent2: The children played with a carefree lightness in the park.
meanings.sent3: His lightness of heart was contagious, spreading joy to all around him.
meanings.sent4: The lightness of her laughter echoed through the meadow.
meanings.sent5: The lightness of their friendship made every moment together special.
